definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: We regard scientific research as the first driving force of the reform and development of education.
sentences.chinese: 學校把教科研工作作爲教育改革與發展的第一推動力。

sentences.english: Therefore, neoteric peasant movements are the major impetus of Chinas earlier modernization.
sentences.chinese: 因此，近代農民運動是中國早期現代化的主要推動力。

sentences.english: Literary criticism is an impetus of development of literary creation.
sentences.chinese: 文藝評論是文藝創作發展的推動力。

sentences.english: An effective policy of finance and tax is the main impetus to recycling economy.
sentences.chinese: 有效的財稅政策是循環經濟發展的主要推動力。

sentences.english: But his anti-corruption law and an ethics task-force did not go far enough.
sentences.chinese: 但是他的反腐敗法和道德工作推動力遠遠還不夠。

sentences.english: However, the support and motivation of incorruption system by the incorruption culture can not be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 但是，廉政文化對制度反腐的支持和推動力不容小覷。

sentences.english: Stare Decisis has a forward thrust.
sentences.chinese: 遵循先例有一種向前的推動力。

sentences.english: The propellant came from the top.
This gift from God is the motivation for my giving to God and others.
sentences.chinese: 這從神而來的禮物亦是我給予神和別人禮物的推動力。

sentences.english: I believe it will become an even greater one in the common tasks that lie ahead.
sentences.chinese: 我相信在未來的共同任務中，它將成爲更大的推動力。

sentences.english: The apportionment of global human resources is ultimately a force for competitive advantage.
sentences.chinese: 全球人力資源的分配最終是一個競爭優勢的推動力。

sentences.english: Everything depended ultimately upon the driving power of human muscle, the muscle of ignorant and subjugated men.
sentences.chinese: 事事最終要靠愚昧的馴從者的肌肉的推動力。

sentences.english: China is a big driver of the current upturn.
sentences.chinese: 中國是當前經濟形勢好轉的一大推動力。

sentences.english: Non-governmental exchanges have always been the driving force of Sino-Japanese relations.
sentences.chinese: 民間交流始終是中日關係發展的推動力。

sentences.english: The construction of industrial parks has become a driving force for the development of county economy.
sentences.chinese: 產業園區的建設已經成爲縣域經濟發展的推動力。

sentences.english: Such an approach ensures there is an additional motivation for you to be an achiever.
sentences.chinese: 這種機制有一個保證你盡力完成目標的額外推動力。

definition: to drive/to propel/drive (vehicle wheel)/drive mechanism (tape or disk)/device driver (computing software)
